title: History of corporate typefaces
content:
Hello,

Books on the subject of corporate identity and its history, as books about the history of type, are plentiful. But I am looking for some suggestions to books on the history of corporate type, and I havent't really found anything yet. But then, perhaps it's not a book I need but a quick dig into the collective knowledge base that is Typophile.

If, by a corporate typeface, I mean a typeface commissioned, made and used _exclusively_ for a commercial entity or organization, then who made and used the first one? Was it the _Romain du roi_?

What are your favorites through history?

Yours,

ƒ
author: fredo

comments.content:
Hi Fredo,  
lots of information in these threads:  
 [Corporate initiated typeface designs](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017054329/http:/typophile.com/node/27315)  
 [The first comission for an identity typeface?](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017054329/http:/typophile.com/node/42200)  
F
